intro: Kalmia angustifolia rubra, commonly known as the narrowleaf mountain laurel, is a deciduous shrub native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of showy, bell-shaped pink or red flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and partial to full shade, often found in forest understories. Its foliage turns a striking crimson in the fall, adding ornamental value to the landscape. Kalmia angustifolia rubra is also noted for its fragrant flowers and its role in supporting local wildlife.
